ns1:quizQuestion.ns1:questionText: The red curve represents an incidence curve due to an epidemic with R0 = 1.5.
ns1:quizQuestion.ns1:answerText: Which of the other curves might represents an epidemic at the same place with R0 = 2.0? Why?

ns1:quizQuestion.ns1:questionText: The red curve represents an incidence curve due to an epidemic with R0 = 2.5.
ns1:quizQuestion.ns1:answerText: Which of the other curves represents an epidemic with R0 = 1.5? Why?

ns1:quizQuestion.ns1:questionText: The curve above represents the prevalence curve due to an epidemic with R0 = 1.6.
ns1:quizQuestion.ns1:answerText: About how many weeks will the epidemic last? How many days will more than 5000 people be infected? Would an epidemic with R0 = 2.0 last longer than the epidemic shown, or shorter? Why?

ns1:quizQuestion.ns1:questionText: The red curve above represents an attack rate curve due to an epidemic with R0 = 1.8.
ns1:quizQuestion.ns1:answerText: Which of the other curves might represent an attack rate curve? What values of R0 might be associated with the other attack rate curve?
